title: Agent Goal Hijack
description: Goal hijacking targets the core of an agent: its ability to plan and act autonomously. If an attacker can redirect the goal itself, the entire chain of actions becomes compromised. Because agents rely on natural-language input, they often cannot tell the difference between valid instructions and malicious ones. This makes it possible for attackers to rewrite objectives, influence planning, or steer decisions through prompt manipulation, poisoned data, or deceptive tool outputs.
detection_patterns: Malicious emails or invites that silently modify agent instructions
Direct prompt overrides pushing financial or operational misuse
Covert instruction changes that lead to disinformation or risky business decisions
Agent receives untrusted input without validation
No input sanitization for agent prompts
attack_vectors: Zero-click indirect injections in email content triggering harmful actions
Malicious websites feeding instructions that cause data exposure
Scheduled prompts that subtly shift an agent's planning priorities
Poisoned documents instructing ChatGPT to exfiltrate data
EchoLeak (CVE-2025-32711): Zero-click prompt injection in Microsoft 365 Copilot
GitHub Copilot YOLO Mode (CVE-2025-53773): Wormable RCE via prompt injection
AGENTS.MD Hijacking in VS Code (CVE-2025-64660, CVE-2025-61590)

mitigations.description: Validate and sanitize all agent inputs
mitigations.implementation: Implement input validation and sanitization for all agent inputs.

mitigations.description: Protect agent state from unauthorized modification
mitigations.implementation: Implement state validation and integrity checks. Use immutable state where possible.

mitigations.description: Lock system prompts and require human approval for goal-changing actions
mitigations.implementation: Protect system prompts from modification and require approval for goal changes.

mitigations.description: Re-validate intent before executing high-impact tasks
mitigations.implementation: Verify user intent before executing critical operations.
Filter and sanitize all external content before agent processing.

mitigations.description: Continuously monitor for unexpected goal drift
mitigations.implementation: Monitor agent behavior for signs of goal misalignment.

references.title: OWASP Agentic Top 10 - AGENTIC01: Agent Goal Hijack
